sentences: Ma ei teadnud, et sa tulid.
Meie ei olnud teadnud tulevast muutust.
context: The word 'teadnud' is the past participle form of the Estonian verb 'tundma' or 'teadma', meaning 'to know'. In this context, it specifically refers to having knowledge or awareness about something beforehand, being able to predict or foresee something. It's used when someone had prior knowledge or was aware of a situation in advance.
